content.description: Start the same as Cig Machine and go straight up past a couple of smallish blocks just right of the arete before bumping out right to the white pocket. Top out straight up on the jugs and cobbles.
content.protection: Open landing zone. At least one pad.

content.description:
An obvious line on an obvious boulder. Far enough away from the drop-off on the right to be sane, but high enough to make you think otherwise. 

  Climb the gently overhanging line of blocks and pockets to the two large, dark bowling balls high on the face.
content.protection: A few pads, preferably one built for highballs, and a good spotter. The landing is relatively flat with a drop-off behind and to the right. Hold breakage is a possibility so be ready.
content.location: Left side of the giant block, center of the face.

content.description:
A body position problem on good rock with air above a great landing.  

  Squat start at the edge of the drop-off in two large pockets. Sculpted edges and dishes lead slightly left to a good pocket past the lip. Follow the arete right using cobbles and edges until a nice rounded jug on the upper arete allows for a transition onto the face.
content.location:
Southeast face of the Split Boulder. Left side of the upper tier. Look for a chest high 5"X7" block near drop-off, then find the big pockets below. 

  While landing area is fully shaded in the afternoon, the rock itself is in the shade nearly all day.

content.description: Sit start and climb cobbled arete/prow. A striking line, but kinda chossy. Topout a bit to the right of the prow.
content.location: East arete/prow on the south face of Split Rock, 20 or so feet right of Cig Machine.

content.description: Start on big cobbles about 10 feet left of Long Way Home. Climb big cobbles all the way to the top. Up high trend a little left to avoid loose rock.
content.location: North face of Split Rock, a little bit right of the big ledge.

content.description:
Great pocket and block climbing on a tall, steep wall with a perfect landing. Afternoon shade. 

  Squat start just left of the buried rock in two juggy pockets. Make few moves up to a small cobble/pocket (the broken hold) then make a long move directly right to a block pinch. (Edit: The new beta involves the hueco to the right to gain the block pinch.) Move across and then up to a jug. From here a long move up left to a white pocket, then continue straight up to eventually top out at a small palo verde.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. The landing is obstruction free.
content.location: Southeast face of Split Boulder. Cig Machine starts at two jug pockets at the left side of the uphill section, next to the edge of the ledge.

content.description: The most obvious one in the bunch. A massive broken stone on the left side of the boulder field. With climbable lines at reasonable heights on two sides and a third side that tips in at well over 40 feet. This is a proud chunk of rock.
